title: Attach Training Document #3 PDF as static asset and ensure UI opens it reliably

requirements.summary: Add the user-provided Training Document #3 PDF to frontend static assets and ensure the UI link opens the real PDF file.
acceptanceCriteria: The Training Document #3 PDF file is present in the deployed frontend static assets (served from /assets/...).
The backend returns Training Document #3 (id=3) documentUrl pointing to that real /assets/...pdf path (not a route that serves index.html).
In the Training Documents section, clicking Training Document #3 line-2 link opens the PDF in a new browser tab (target=_blank) and displays the PDF content (not the SPA).

file_operations.path: frontend/public/assets/Rise.Articulate 360 -- Course #5  Distinction Codex - Unveiling the Markers-Course Summary_JAN 18, 2026.pdf
file_operations.description: Add the user-provided Training Document #3 PDF to the publicly served static assets so it is accessible under the /assets/ path.

Ensure the Training Document #3 line-2 link uses getStaticAssetUrl(...) and opens the static PDF in a new tab (target=_blank) rather than navigating within the SPA, including handling spaces/special characters in the PDF filename.

requirements.summary: Remove the need for hard-coded URL overrides for Training Document #3 by making the Training Documents link resolution robust and consistently based on getStaticAssetUrl(...).
acceptanceCriteria: Training Document #3 link resolves to the correct PDF URL via getStaticAssetUrl(...) and opens in a new tab.
No navigation back to the SPA occurs when opening Training Document #3 PDF.

file_operations.description: Refactor the existing per-id document URL mapping (currently used for id=2) into a minimal fallback mechanism so Training Document #3 reliably resolves to the new /assets/...pdf when needed, while still preferring the backend-provided documentUrl when it already points to a valid /assets/ PDF.

Confirm and, if needed, adjust getStaticAssetUrl(...) behavior to correctly handle inputs that already include '/assets/' and filenames with spaces/special characters, so Training Document #3 resolves to a real PDF asset URL without SPA routing interference.
